The terror that finds strength and ground in Syria may threaten our country today but tomorrow this terror will spread to the whole world.
Every effort to deepen the problems in our region is like a mine threatening the future of the whole world, especially the Western countries.
Syria and Iraq, the price of crime committed against democracy in Egypt and Libya will be great for the whole world.
We want to take sincere, fair and solution-focused steps in these issues before it is too late.

Situation on EU borders critical. We can no longer allow solidarity to be equivalent to naivety, openness to helplessness, freedom to chaos.
Today no task more important than re-establishing EU's external borders. Not to make EU an inaccessible fortress but to protect our values.
We must end completely unnecessary argument between protecting external borders & solidarity/openness. We need a rational hybrid of both.

RM180j provided bg natural disaster management, RM730j bg SRJK Flood Mitigation Plan & RM60j GRM for Flood Forecasting and Warning Ignore # Bajet2016
A total RM17.3b prepared for camp. Bg defense procurement 6 pieces Littoral Combatant Ship, armored cars, Airbus A-400M etc. # Bajet2016
RM523j allocated land for the construction of military camps in Sabah ESSCOM, RM160j allocated 4K bg build more units of quarters ATM # Bajet2016
To reduce the crime rate, RM155j for the construction of two new police headquarters in the Old & KK, 10 IPD and 5 police station that in the construction # Bajet2016
2k unit plans to build more affordable houses for the police, RM36j for office building, staff quarters and upgrading immigration detention depot # Bajet2016
RM50j bg improve prison security measures; RM20j for the Safe City Program in the black # 60 Bajet2016
The addition of 500 units and 500 Police Motorcycle Patrol unit patrol cars with a total allocation of RM35j # Bajet2016
Bg strengthened integrity and business's Reduce leakages / corruption, the MACC will continue dimantapkn. PGW MACC bill will be added per requirement # Bajet2016
# Bajet2016: For Rewarding Public Service, for his contributions and service to the nation, the Government agreed:
1. Give the benefit of the salary transfer brsmaan 1 annual salary increases per grade that will benefit 1.6 million with an allocation of RM1.1 billion; # Bajet2016
2. Improving of 252 schemes of service which will benefit 406 thousand civil servants; # Bajet2016
3. Set the lowest starting salary in the Public Service KPD $ 1200 per month which will benefit 60 thousand civil servants; # Bajet2016
4. Set the minimum pension of RM950 a month, involving Synonym 50k sekurang2nya retired civil servants with 25 years of service; # Bajet2016
5. To appoint permanent appointment Contract of Service officer who served sekurang2nya 15 years. Utilizing 10k contract employee # Bajet2016
Implementation of these measures will take effect on July 1, 2016 with an allocation of RM1.4b # Bajet2016
In effort to ease the cost of living, the Bantuan Rakyat 1Malaysia or BR1M will continue. # Bajet2016
Bajet2016: In accordance with the Barisan Nasional Government Undertakings, is pleased to announce a number of BR1M for 2016 will be increased like the following:
1) A new category introduced bg recipient in e-Kasih list with a monthly income below which will receive BR1M exceeded RM1k RM1050 # Bajet2016
2) For households with monthly income RM3k down, BR1M was increased from RM950 to RM1,000; # Bajet2016
3) For households earning between RM3,001 to RM4k, BR1M was increased from RM750 to RM800 KPD; # Bajet2016
4) For Funeral Scheme is a grant of RM1,000 will be continued; # Bajet2016
5) For single individuals 21 years of age, income does not exceed RM2K month, the KPD was raised from RM350 to RM400. # Bajet2016
All of this will help take advantage of 4.7M households and single individuals 2.7j, with provisions RM5.9b # Bajet2016
In the 11MP, I mentioned about the group B40, in # Bajet2016, 1 large group that the Government will also focus now called M40.
# Bajet2016: initial interpretation M40, a group of RM3,860-RM8,320 monthly gross income households. This definition will be detailed. We are pleased to announce:
1) Limit bg tax relief per child aged below 18 years from assessment 2016, doubled from KPD RM1000 RM2000; # Bajet2016
2) release the individual tax payer bg spouse who has no income, increased from KPD RM3000 RM4000; # Bajet2016
3) Anak2 who support his parents, wpun not live with, given the accumulated exceeded RM1,500 tax relief for the mother and father masing2 (1/2) # Bajet2016
4) Provided the mother and father, aged 60 years and over with income not exceeding RM2,000 a month (2/2) # Bajet2016
5) Limit of tax relief is increased from RM6k KPD bg RM8k every child 18 yrs or older who currently studies continue bg year of assessment 2016 # Bajet2016
6) Bg KPD NK2 parent who continue learning disabilities, the tax exemption limit from RM6k KPD dinaikkn RM8k from year of assessment 2016 (1/2) # Bajet2016
6) Had the existing relief RM6k parents with disabled children. If children continue their studies, the amount can be claimed RM14k. (2/2) # Bajet2016
Bg allow more workers interchangeable SOCSO benefits, eligibility increased contribution from salary RM3k KPD RM4k month. (1/2) # Bajet2016
Utilizing 500k employees, if Contributors died within working beneficiaries receive a monthly refund of 90% pndptan end (2/2) # Bajet2016
Effective July 1, 2016, the national minimum wage was increased from RM900 to RM1,000 per month for Peninsula Boy (1/2) # Bajet2016
Salary min Sabah, Labuan and Sarawak's dinaikkn RM920 to RM800 a month from all sectors kcuali bg perkhdmatn domstik / pmbntu home (2/2) # Bajet2016
Civil servants will receive a special grant of RM500 in January 2016 # Bajet2016
Government Pensioners will receive special assistance of RM250. # Bajet2016
